subject: Self Care
title: Body Signals and Feelings
description: A quick win: understand Body Signals and Feelings.

hook.text: Your stomach tightened in the meeting before you consciously felt anxious. Your body knew first.

buildup.text: Emotions begin as physical sensations. The body reacts before the conscious mind labels the experience.

discovery.text: Finnish research mapped emotions in the body. Anger heats the chest. Sadness numbs the limbs. Fear grips the gut.

twist.text: People who ignore body signals miss emotional cues. They get blindsided by feelings they could have caught early.

climax.text: Check in with your body three times daily. Notice tension, warmth, or numbness. These are your emotional compass.

punchline.text: Your body feels it first. Learn to listen closely.

quiz.question: What did Finnish research reveal about emotions?
options: Emotions only exist in the brain
Different emotions create distinct physical sensation maps in the body
Body signals are unrelated to feelings
